Title: Mathematician at Heart
Description: I've always been enticed with mathematics, i knew I was always simply a math guy. In my final year of undergrad, I transitioned from Computer Engineering to Applied Mathematics because I knew I wanted to do software development and wanted to take the last chance to challenge myself with material I always found difficult. At the end of it all, I've discovered that to do math is to learn how to learn and that practice is what allowed me to develop the skillsets I possess today and will aquire tomorrow.

Title: Full-Stack Engineer by Trade
Description: Just because an answer is right does not mean that it is correct. Lessons learned at my first role at Proplogix maintaining a legacy CakePHP project then contributing to a .NET CORE web application, I know that designing a solution that fits a project's paradigm is different than just developing a correct answer that meets requirements. Through practical experience brings the intuition to differentiate the two.

Title: Tutoring as a Mutualistic Relationship.
Description: The best way to learn is by conveying information in a way that is digestable to others. I've gained my experience working as a STEM tutor throughout college in the CARE Program. I've enjoyed it so much, i work part time doing the same at an afterschool program named Coding with Kids here in Austin. I'm only better for it. It's our responsibility to aid others towards walking the same path we walk if we have the capacity for it.

Title: Manga for the Win
Description: My current hobby is catching up on all the greats that manga has to offer. GO READ VAGABOND || HUMONCULUS!

Title: We are Human
Description: We create because we are drawn to things that we feel challenged to do. I am a lifter, a fraternity brother, a family man, most importantly I am human. My reason to be here? I just want to make cool sh*t!
